column4: Hi Monika: it's 6.06 LTS. I'm embarrassed that I don't know how to tell which soundcard I have. It's on a Thinkpad T42. How can I check?
asoundconf list
Monika: It gives me I82801DBICH4.
Monika: I'm on Gnome. Does that output help?
Yes, but I'm not sure which keywords to use. A lot of people can't get sound to work at all, but that's not what I'm looking for help with. What should I search for?
that driver is dmixed by default.
just don't use arts or esound
tell applications to use alsa by default
Thanks Judicata and crimsun!
Crimsun -- how do I change it?
the only thing you need to change is to disable esound and arts
how do I do that?
should I uncheck "Enable software sound mixing"?
yes
Anything else? Would I now be using ALSA?
(to crimsun)
you have to disable arts, I presume?
how do I disable arts?
use the kde control center
or kde system setting
I'm in Gnome -- I don't see an option in my Preferences > Sound.
what kde applications do you have installed that use arts?
